trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCommand"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCommand> event is raised when a button in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control is clicked.
This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control also raises other events when certain buttons are clicked (for example, buttons with the `CommandName` property set to "Delete", "Update", or "Page").

When you use one of these buttons, you can handle one of the specialized events that are provided by the control, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDeleted> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDeleting> events.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs> object is passed to the event-handling method, which enables you to determine the command name and command argument of the button that was clicked.

To determine the command name use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property, and to determine the command argument, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property.
You can also access the button control that raised the event by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs"></xref> class by using the specified source of the command and event arguments.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs> class.
This constructor is primarily used by control developers when they raise events.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial value

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object that is contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object that is contained in the `originalArgs` parameter.
The object that is contained in the `commandSource` parameter.
The item from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control for which the command was issued.
The source of the command.
The event data.
Gets the source of the command.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to access the properties of the object that represents the source of the command.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCommandEventArgs> object, the source of the command is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control that contains the button clicked by the user.
The source of the command.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control has handled the event.
Set this property to `true` in the event handler to specify that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control should not handle the event because you are handling it in your code.
`true` if data-bound event code was skipped or has finished; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the data item for which the command was issued.
The data item from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control for which the command was issued.
